title: How to watch LPL, LCK, EU LCS, and NA LCS
body: We’re gearing up for another exciting season of esports. It’s time to equip your favorite team icon and cheer on some epic gameplay as we head into the first split of 2018. Let’s review when LPL, LCK, EU LCS and NA LCS return, where to watch with their English broadcasts, and how to keep up with all the action:

replies.body: how do I watch academy team?

> [{quoted}](name=Koragon,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=AWPYHVB0,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-01-16T20:13:59.986+0000)
>
> how do I watch academy team?

Hey Koragon! [We confirmed last week](http://www.lolesports.com/en_US/articles/2018-academy-league-roster-rules-update) that Academy League will be broadcasted at 3:00 PM PT or following the EU LCS on Fridays. The Academy broadcast kicks off tomorrow (Fri, Jan 19) on [Lolesports.com](http://www.lolesports.com/en_US/), [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/riotgames), or [YouTube](http://youtube.com/lolesports). 

Who are you looking forward to watching in Academy?
Um did you read the title? If you didn't it's  "How to watch LPL, LCK, EU LCS, and NA LCS". If you want to know when the LMS starts it's easy enough to google "when does the lol LMS start?"
{{item:2319}}  Can't make money off the small population region, so Riot just completely abandon it....
First day of LPL vods in english . Second day no commentary at all. Both weeks so far. Maybe you should get your sh*t in one sock.
